message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location and appearance of the brain lesions suggest multiple metastases, and lung cancer is the most common cause of brain metastases among the options.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location and symptoms of the patient are suggestive of brain metastases, and among the options, lung cancer is the most common cause of brain metastases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of round, well-demarcated lesions in the brain parenchyma at the junction between gray and white matter is consistent with metastases from lung cancer. The other organ options are unlikely to metastasize to the brain in this manner.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The round, well-demarcated lesions in the brain parenchyma at the junction between gray and white matter suggest metastatic brain tumors. Among the options, lung cancer is the most likely to metastasize to the brain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The MRI findings suggest metastatic cancer, and the most common sites of cancer that metastasize to the brain are lung, breast, and melanoma. Among the options, lung cancer is the most likely cause of the brain lesions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location of the brain lesions at the junction of gray and white matter, and the history of recurrent headaches and dizziness, suggest metastasis from a primary lung cancer. None of the other options are commonly associated with brain metastases.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location of the lesions suggests that they are likely metastases. Among the options, lung cancer is the most common cause of brain metastases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location and characteristics of the brain lesions are consistent with metastatic cancer. Among the options, lung cancer is the most common cause of brain metastasis.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The MRI findings suggest that the patient has brain metastases. Among the options, lung cancer is the most common cause of brain metastases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and MRI findings are suggestive of brain metastases. Among the options, lung is the most common primary site for brain metastases. Prostate and kidney are associated with bone metastases, and skin is associated with lymph node metastases.
